snippet: Researchers recruited 965 people with stable coronary artery disease, tracking their statin use and depressive symptoms over six years.
abstract: Dr Mary A Whooley study published online in The Journal of Clinical Psychiatry finds that the use of statin drugs to lower cholesterol in people with stable coronary artery disease is associated with a significantly reduced risk for depression.
lead_paragraph: Researchers recruited 965 people with stable coronary artery disease, tracking their statin use and depressive symptoms over six years.

headline.seo: Possible Link Between Statin Use and Lower Depression Risk
headline.main: Mental Health: Use of Statins May Lower Depression Risk
headline.print_headline: Mental Health: Use of Statins May Lower Depression Risk
